src:
FOTO: Najvišji leseni stolp na svetu
Koroški Pyramidenkogel je od leta 2013, ko so ga postavili, izjemno priljubljena turistična točka; nanj se povzpnete po 441 stopnicah ali s panoramskim dvigalom, spustite se lahko po toboganu.
03 Nov 2019, 12:54 by Primož Hieng



Pyramidenkogel je priljubljena turistična točka.



Hrib Jedvovca je povišal za 100 metrov.



Stolp je odprt vse dni v letu.



Nepozaben razgled


Zaradi bližine Slovenije in izjemne atraktivnosti je za ogled zelo zanimiv razgledni stolp Pyramidenkogel, ki je blizu kraja Hodiše (Keutschach am See) na avstrijskem Koroškem, enega izmed krajev, kjer živijo koroški Slovenci.Naselje Hodiše leži okoli poldrugi kilometer severovzhodno od Hodiškega jezera in približno 15 km zahodno od Celovca. Na vrhu Jedvovce na nadmorski višini 851 m so leta 2013 odprli nov razgledni stolp, ki je z višino 100 m najvišji leseni tovrstni na svetu. Konstrukcija je narejena iz 16 mogočnih, eliptično razporejenih lameliranih lepljenih nosilcev iz macesnovine in 80 diagonalnih opornikov iz jekla.


Nepozaben razgled

Dejanska konstrukcija v višino meri 67 m. Nanjo je postavljena glava stolpa z dvema najvišjima razglednima ploščadma in Sky Boxom, ki je v devetem nadstropju. Ta je zastekljen z vseh strani ter s tem zaščiten pred vetrom in vremenskimi vplivi. Na skoraj 71 m je ploščad za obiskovalce; največja od treh razglednih ploščadi je na višini 64,16 m. S konico antene, ki je dolga 18 m, zgradba meri natančno 100 m.Med vzponom po 441 stopnicah in med vožnjo s panoramskim dvigalom obiskovalci lahko uživajo v 360-stopinjskem razgledu na čudovito koroško jezersko in gorsko pokrajino. Dvigalo do 20 oseb popelje na višino 71 m. Z 52 m se vse do pritličja spušča najvišja zaprta drča v zgradbi, ki je dolga 120 m. Med spustom lahko dosežemo hitrost do okoli 25 km/h, spust pa traja 20 sekund.


Hrib Jedvovca je povišal za 100 metrov.

V osnovni zgradbi so v pritličju restavracija z domačo in mednarodno kuhinjo, prodajalna vstopnic in trgovina s spominki. V zunanjem predelu je veliko igrišče, ki malčke vabi k zabavi; opremljeno je s plezalno konstrukcijo s toboganom ter več gugalnicami in igralno vzpetino, v kateri se skriva sistem predorov. Na koncu terase je igralna hišica.Obiskovalci se lahko do tja najudobneje podajo z avtomobilom ali avtobusom, za nemoten dostop je v neposredni bližini urejenih nekaj mest za invalidne osebe. Med krajema Ribnica (Reifnitz), kjer je občinsko kopališče, in v bližini pristanišča za ladje Reifnitz in Jedvovca (Pyramidenkogel) je v poletnih mesecih, od 15. maja do 15. septembra, na voljo avtobusna povezava.
Narejen je iz macesnovine in opornikov iz jekla.
Obisk razglednega stolpa in vožnjo z avtobusom je mogoče s kombinirano vstopnico kupiti v povezavi z vožnjo z ladjico WSG po največjem koroškem jezeru, Vrbskem jezeru, in tudi z vstopom v Minimundus, znani miniaturni svet ob Vrbskem jezeru.Pyramidenkogel je odprt vsak dan. Ker ga je treba pozimi zaradi obilnega sneženja kratkoročno zapreti, vas prosijo, da jih pred načrtovanim obiskom pokličete, sicer pa je marca in aprila odprt od 10. do 18. ure, maja od 9. do 19. ure, junija od 9. do 20. ure, julija in avgusta od 9. do 21. ure, septembra od 9. do 19. ure, oktobra od 10. do 18. ure ter novembra, decembra, januarja in februarja od 10. do 17. ure. Zadnji vstop je vedno pol ure pred koncem obratovalnega časa.
Visok je 100 metrov in stoji na vrhu Jedvovce na nadmorski višini 851 m.
Cena vstopnice za odrasle je 14 evrov, za otroke od 6 do 15 let 6,5 evra, za otroke do 5. leta pa vstopnine ni. Za mladince (16–17 let), invalidne osebe, študente ter pripadnike civilne in vojaške službe je cena vstopnice 10 evrov. Preostalo ponudbo si lahko ogledate na njihovi spletni strani.
text:
PHOTO: The tallest wooden tower in the world
The Carinthian Pyramidenkogel has been an extremely popular tourist destination since 2013 when it was built; climb 441 stairs or with a panoramic lift, you can climb the slide.
03 Nov 2019, 12:54 by Primoz Hieng



Pyramidenkogel is a popular tourist destination.



He raised the hill of Jedvovac by 100 meters.



The tower is open all day of the year.



An unforgettable view


Due to its proximity to Slovenia and its exceptional attractiveness, the Pyramidenkogel lookout tower near Keutschach am See in Carinthia, one of the places inhabited by Carinthian Slovenes, is very interesting to see. 15 km west of Klagenfurt. At Jedvovca summit at an altitude of 851 m, a new lookout tower was opened in 2013, with the height of 100 m being the highest of its kind in the world. The construction is made of 16 powerful, elliptically spaced laminated laminated lampholders and 80 diagonal steel struts.


An unforgettable view

The actual construction measures 67 m in height. It has a tower head with two highest viewing platforms and a Sky Box on the ninth floor. It is glazed on all sides to protect against wind and weather. At nearly 71m there is a visitor platform; the largest of the three viewing platforms is at an altitude of 64.16 m. With an antenna tip that is 18 m long, the building measures exactly 100 m. During the ascent of 441 stairs and while riding the panoramic lift, visitors can enjoy 360-degree views of the beautiful Carinthian lake and mountain landscape. It can take up to 20 people to a height of 71 m. From the 52 m down to the ground floor, the highest closed slide in the building is 120 m long. During the descent, the speed can be reached up to about 25 km / h and the descent lasts for 20 seconds.


He raised the hill of Jedvovac by 100 meters.

The basic building has a restaurant serving local and international cuisine, a ticket store and a souvenir shop on the ground floor. There is a large playground outside, inviting toddlers to party; it is equipped with a climbing structure with a slide and several swings and a playground hiding a tunnel system. There is a playhouse at the end of the terrace. Visitors can be reached most comfortably by car or bus, with several places for disabled people in the immediate vicinity. There is a bus connection between Ribnitz (Reifnitz), where there is a municipal bath, and near the port for the Reifnitz and Pyramidenkogel ships during the summer months, from 15 May to 15 September.
Made of larch and steel brackets.
A visit to the lookout tower and bus ride can be purchased with a combined ticket in connection with the WSG boat ride through the largest lake in Carinthia, as well as by entering Minimundus, a well-known miniature world by Lake Vrbani. Pyramidenkogel is open daily. As it should be closed in the short term in the winter because of heavy snowfall, you are asked to call them before your scheduled visit, otherwise it is open in March and April from 10am to 6pm, May from 9am to 7pm, June from 9am 8pm, July and August from 9am to 9pm, September from 9am to 7pm, October from 10am to 6pm and November, December, January and February from 10am to 5pm. The last entry is always half an hour before the end of business hours.
It is 100 meters high and stands atop Jedvovca at an elevation of 851 m.
The price for an adult ticket is $ 14, for children 6 to 15 years is $ 6.5, and for children under 5, there is no entry fee. For juniors (16-17 years old), disabled people, students and members of the civilian and military service, the ticket price is $ 10. You can see the rest of the offer on their website.
